title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 149-3.5 - Expenditure check

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 149-3.5 - Expenditure check

State Regulations
A school district which spends less in local funds during
the current year than in the base year for the purposes of reducing class size
and increasing individualized attention in grades one, two and three through an
early grade intervention program, shall have its apportionment of comprehensive
operating aid under subdivision 12 of section
3602
of the

Education Law reduced in an amount equal to such deficiency in the current year
or the succeeding school year. In addition, a district which spends any part of
its total annual setaside attributable to early grade intervention in an
unauthorized manner in the base year shall have its current year apportionment
of comprehensive operating aid reduced in an amount equal to the amount of such
unauthorized expenditures. In no event shall the reductions assessed pursuant
to this section on the current year apportionment of comprehensive operating
aid, be deducted from the setasides required pursuant to this Part and
paragraphs f, g and h of section
3602
of the

Education Law. Notes
